page.title: 10A day of a dairyman 1
page.content: This is an account of the work of a dairyman based on our findings at Potterland Farm. My day starts between 4.30 and 5.00 am. I go out and get my dog and we go up the field and bring in the cows. We take them in to the byre and tie them up with chains round the neck. Next, I go to the dairy to get the milking machines, there are 6 of them and there are between 60 and 70 cows. I fix them on to the pipe-line where the milk travels through and goes into the dairy. It goes into a big metal tank where it is kept cold. We let the cows out to the fields again and then we have to clean the byre.
